timeline.bodyText: Could we cache this so it's not loaded as many times as the number of service methods?
timeline.author: trustin

timeline.bodyText:
from FS. File could be removed for brevity:


Missing an


Need to use {} instead of concatenation
"Failed to load an API description file: {}", fileName, exception
timeline.author: trustin

replies.bodyText: I have to use the concatenation because otherwise the logger thinks the exception is a second argument for the string...
replies.author: hueneburg

replies.bodyText:
Really? I don't think so. This should work as expected for sure:
logger.warn("Failed to load an API description file: {}", fileName, exception);
replies.author: trustin

replies.bodyText:
Unlike the Javadoc and the method signature, Logging frameworks differently works if the last parameter is an instance of Throwable. It extracts throwable from the object params.
https://github.com/qos-ch/logback/blob/7ee74ad132bf74ead68c5bb553f5353aa2588bb0/logback-classic/src/main/java/ch/qos/logback/classic/Logger.java#L701-L703
https://github.com/qos-ch/logback/blob/7ee74ad132bf74ead68c5bb553f5353aa2588bb0/logback-classic/src/main/java/ch/qos/logback/classic/spi/LoggingEvent.java#L126-L128
replies.author: ikhoon

timeline.author: ikhoon
ikhoon

timeline.bodyText: As you know, @param documentation will have a lower priority than a @Description annotation. Could you make a test for it? 😉
timeline.author: ikhoon

timeline.bodyText: Should this be WARNING or ERROR?

timeline.message: Enable using generated documentation properties files in DocService
Add tests and handle stacktrace better

timeline.author: minwoox

timeline.bodyText:
Let's rephrase a little bit for consistency:
Failed to write properties for: ...
Also, how about using System.lineSeparator()?
timeline.author: minwoox

replies.bodyText: Java handles platform specific things somewhat inconsistent... for the old io api it didn't matter if you used / or \ on windows but here it does matter whether you use \n or \r\n...
replies.author: hueneburg

timeline.bodyText:
nit: Could you move this constructor below the static method?
https://line.github.io/armeria/community/developer-guide#organize
timeline.author: ikhoon

replies.bodyText: Do you use the @UtilityClass lombok annotation? then it would remove all the boiler plate (no static needed for class members, no final needed for class, no private constructor needed for class)
replies.author: hueneburg

replies.bodyText: Nope, we don't use Lombok so that Armeria values performance and provides optimized code and Javadoc.
replies.author: ikhoon
